article.headline: South Carolina St 72, Norfolk State 52
article.story: ORANGEBURG, S.C. (AP) -- Brian Mason scored 19 points as South Carolina State beat Norfolk State 72-52 Monday night. The Bulldogs (11-15, 9-7 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference) scored the final 11 points of the first half to take a 37-24 lead at the break. South Carolina State then went on another 11-0 run early in the second half to take a 56-31 lead. The Bulldogs would lead by at least 20 the rest of the way. The Bulldogs shot 50 percent (27-of-54) from the field and 87.5 percent (14-of-16) from the foul line. The Spartans shot just 39.6 percent (21-of-53) from the field, including missing all eight of their 3s, as well as shooting 47.6 percent (10-of-21) on free throws. South Carolina State is now a half-game ahead of the Spartans (10-17, 9-8) for fifth place in the MEAC and a bye into the quarterfinals of the conference tournament. Karandick Ogunride led the Spartans with 12 points, while Corey Lyons added 10 points and six rebounds. Derrick Davis added 13 points and Robert Baker and Chris Miller-Williams each added 10 for the Bulldogs.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
